output_list.reason: The mintToken function does not check for overflow, allowing the owner to mint an arbitrary large amount of tokens.
The transfer function does not check if the target address is a contract, allowing the transfer of tokens to a smart contract that can cause a denial of service.
The transferFrom function does not check if the target address is a contract, allowing the transfer of tokens to a smart contract that can cause a denial of service.
The buy function does not check for overflow, allowing users to buy an arbitrary large amount of tokens.
The MorphToken function unintentionally exposes the constructor function, allowing any user to claim ownership and funds.
